How can I retrieve a raw transaction using the Verus command line interface?

You can retrieve a raw transaction using the `getrawtransaction` command followed by the transaction ID (txid). The basic syntax is:
```
verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
```
This will return the raw transaction data for the specified txid.

Examples:
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the purpose of the second argument in the `getrawtransaction` command?

The second argument in the `getrawtransaction` command is an optional verbosity level. If set to 1, it will return more detailed information about the transaction. For example:
```
verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
```
This will return a more verbose output of the transaction data.

Examples:
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I use the `getrawtransaction` method using the JSON-RPC interface?

You can use the `getrawtransaction` method using the JSON-RPC interface by sending a JSON payload to the Verus RPC server. The basic syntax is:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This will send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus RPC server to retrieve the raw transaction data for the specified txid.

Examples:
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
